metadata.title: CVE-2017-17969 on Ubuntu 16.04 FIPS Compliant (xenial) - medium
metadata.description:
Heap-based buffer overflow in the NCompress::NShrink::CDecoder::CodeRealmethod in 7-Zip before 18.00 and p7zip allows remote attackers to cause adenial of service (out-of-bounds write) or potentially execute arbitrarycode via a crafted ZIP archive.

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2017-17969` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

p7zip - 9.20.1~dfsg.1-4.2ubuntu0.1
p7zip-full - 9.20.1~dfsg.1-4.2ubuntu0.1
No subscription required

criterions.comment: p7zip package in xenial was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '9.20.1~dfsg.1-4.2ubuntu0.1').
